title: BF Football
text:
BF Football is a <a href="Manchester">Manchester</a>-based sports investment company that was co-founded by <a href="Ladbrokes%20plc">Ladbrokes plc</a> and <a href="William%20Hill%20%28bookmaker%29">William Hill Limited</a> in March 2017. It mainly offers <a href="association%20football">football</a>-related products and services, including <a href="football%20club">football club</a>s, football academies and technical support. Its main products are BF Football APP and BF Football website.
Ladbrokes plc and William Hill Limited are the founding investors in BF Football, with the former holding a 20% stake in it and the latter a 30% stake. <a href="City%20Football%20Group">City Football Group</a> (CFG) took a 50% stake in BF Football in November 2021, making it its largest shareholder. <a href="City%20Football%20Group">CFG</a>, which was established in May 2013, controls several football clubs, including <a href="Manchester%20City%20F.C.">Manchester City F.C.</a> and <a href="New%20York%20City%20F.C.">New York City F.C.</a>, and received a $500 million equity investment from <a href="Silver%20Lake%20%28investment%20firm%29">Silver Lake</a> in 2019. The company's second largest shareholder is William Hill Limited, which was founded in 1934 and previously listed on the <a href="London%20Stock%20Exchange">London Stock Exchange</a>.
History.
BF Football stepped into the <a href="Industry%20%28economics%29">football industry</a> in 2017, with its franchising program focusing on soccer.
In November 2021, CFG took a stake in BF Football, resulting in it becoming the largest shareholder in the company.
